body_html:
Indeed, a full repro would be useful. That being said, I think I might've just repro-ed this case (except with a 1D convolution lol).

In the diagram below, is what you mean that the kernel and bias Variables within the conv1d_2 box really belong to conv1d_3? And that the kernel and bias Variables within the conv1d_1 box really belong to conv1d_2?

If so, this looks like a tflearn or TF convolution op scoping-related bug. I'll do a little research on that.

body:
Indeed, a full repro would be useful. That being said, I think I might've just repro-ed this case (except with a 1D convolution lol).

In the diagram below, is what you mean that the `kernel` and `bias` Variables within the conv1d_2 box really belong to conv1d_3? And that the `kernel` and `bias` Variables within the conv1d_1 box really belong to conv1d_2?

![pbcpih3hgdx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4221553/23194401/bce29ff0-f862-11e6-85e9-4849bdce9713.png)

If so, this looks like a tflearn or TF convolution op scoping-related bug. I'll do a little research on that.
